definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: One debt collector in Spain uses public shaming a tool of coercion.
sentences.chinese: 一名西班牙讨债者也正在使用公开羞辱作为胁迫工具。

sentences.english: Thus, old Wan had to set foot on the road of debt collection on his own.
sentences.chinese: 于是，老宛独自一人踏上了讨债之路。

sentences.english: By September over 100 moneylenders were showing up at his premises every day demanding repayment.
sentences.chinese: 但到了9月，每天都有将近100多人蹲点向他讨债。

sentences.english: Father of avoid dunning, no sign of drag more female debt collection harassment.
sentences.chinese: 欣父规避追债没了踪迹，拖累欣母倍受讨债骚扰。

sentences.english: Creditors chasing the door by flesh, even the capital turnover are dubious.
sentences.chinese: 被债主追着上门讨债，连资金周转都成问题。

sentences.english: The company gave me dunning letters and calls.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司给我来了许多讨债信和催债电话。

sentences.english: Andy spun out some drug list and quantity, cheat dunner.
sentences.chinese: 安迪胡编乱造出一些药品名单和数量，骗住了讨债人。

sentences.english: To demand money from a person who has just lost his job is hitting a man who is down.
sentences.chinese: 向一个刚刚失业的人讨债等于落井下石。

definition: to press for payment of debts/to dun
to demand payment/to collect overdue payment
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to demand payment of money owing
